Reviews.Title: “Great location and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Bocephus99
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night on a recent business trip. The hotel was convenient to everything you'd want to do in New Orleans. It was quiet at night and the staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel appeared at all times to be clean and tidy. The bathroom had nice walk-in showers with new, updated tile. Overall a very modern hotel. A previous poster here mentioned bed bugs. I admit I did notice a three bug bites after I had departed, but I am not certain they came from bed bugs (not that I doubt the previous poster). I did an awful lot of walking around the city over the course of time I was there, so they could have come from anything as far as I know. New Orleans is pretty buggy this time of year.

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS - Horrific Service and Treatment”
Reviews.Author: wyn123678
Reviews.Content: My Girlfriend, her friend and myself all stayed at this Courtyard earlier this year. All three of us slept in the room this evening. When we woke up all of us noticed small bite marks on different parts of our body. After getting a shower and getting into the car I slowly realized just how many bites I had on the drive back home. I was covered in bug bites. The bites were large and swollen on me and little concentrated red ones on my girlfriend. I checked my body when I got home and found 35+ bites on my scalp, eyelid, forehead, arms, legs, back, chest, and so on. Due to the severity of the bites and my swollen eye I went to the doctor who confirmed that these were bites and most likely bed bug bites due to the pattern of the bites and the location where I got them. I brought this to the managerâ€™s attention at the hotel that proceeded to get the room checked for evidence; he called to tell me that they checked the room and did not find any trace of bedbugs. The manager I spoke with kept blaming it on bugs outside in the streets. I explained that we were no where else to get the bites and that when we entered the room no one had any bites and 8 hours later when we woke up all three of us had the same bites. I further explained that they could be fleas or something but something in the room bit all of us in an extreme manner. The manager was no help and was accusatory. I eventually got put in touch with a claims department whoâ€™s customer service was even worse than the manager at the hotel. I explained that I am a platinum member and have never filed a claim or made a formal complaint before and I stay in Marriott hotels over 200+ nights a year for 4 years now. I was still treated like a liar. No manager would ever show me proof that the room was checked and cleared of bed bugs. I forwarded the claims department photos of both my bites and my girlfriendâ€™s bites along with a doctors bill and prescription bills for the visit after the hotel stay. I was refused any payment for my belongings that I discarded before getting back to my home. In the end Marriott treated me horrible. The management staff refused to pay for the bag that I had to throw out and the change of clothes that we threw out. I wanted my experience to be heard so that future customers can no what to expect from Marriott regarding their handling of a situation such as this. Keep in mind that I am a high level Platinum Elite member and this is how I was treated. Imagine if how they would treat someone with no status at this company.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Wanda B
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited New Orleans for our anniversary. The hotel was near the French quarter and walking distance to other attractions. The hotel was clean and the staff were helpful. We were near canal street that consisted of shopping, eating, and the streetcar. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: Cindonesia
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Courtyard near the French Quarter for a Girls' Weekend. I originally wanted to stay in a B&B for a more authentic New Orleans experience, but we opted to stay at the Marriott because my friend was able to get a good rate and because we didn't want to risk staying somewhere without a good A/C. I think we made a good choice for what we neede The hotel is in a great location in the French Quarter. There's a huge lobby and breakfast/bar area which always smelled so good (weird, but I noticed every time we came back in). Service was okay, not great. They helped get cabs and with directions, but seemed a bit put out and they didn't go out of their way by any means. We were also little disappointed that they weren't serving either time we tried to grab something quick from the bar area. The room itself was what we expected. Big, clean, and a working TV & air conditioning. Exactly what we were looking for! I also used the gym while I was there. It's small but clean and has a decent selection of equipment. There's a whirlpool in the room next door, though I didn't use it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Comfortable Lobby”
Reviews.Author: Nufi1117
Reviews.Content: Just the right distance from French Quarter, Burbon St, River Walk, Convention Center, and Superdome. Walking distance or inexpensive cab ride to any of these. Free Internet Sevice was nice amenity. Lobby decor is very nice, comfortable seating, and ample space for waiting or greeting others. Staff was cordial but valet/doorman was unattentive at best. Hotel and room was clean. Room was small but comfortable with small fridge and coffee - no safe. Bed/bedding was comfortable. Housekeeping knocked on the door at 8am EVERY morning... not cool when you're on vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but staff kinda rude”
Reviews.Author: blonde83
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nice and in a great location but the staff was just rude. I have stayed here twice and each time the valet attendant and front desk staff have just been rude. The first time I stayed the I had to leave early in the morning. I called the front desk to send for my car. The valet guy brought the wrong car and took his time to go get my car so I was late getting on the road. The next time I stayed I had to leave early again. The girl at grave yard shift at the front desk would never answer the phone so I had to go downstairs and ask for my car. She was had an attitude and said she was in the back. So rude. Like I said the hotel is nice but the staff was just rude. Good customer service really goes a long way.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, clean, nicely furnished, large rooms, good sized bathroom”
Reviews.Author: G D
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for our stay in New Orleans near the French quarter. The rooms were a good size, clean, and the lobby was spacious, modern and well-kept. I'd highly recommend this hotel. The front desk clerk was very accommodating and helpful and the bell hop was great at providing trolley information. There is no pool and we did not try out the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Will be staying here again.”
Reviews.Author: krisveil
Reviews.Content: We usually stay at another pricier French Quarter hotel. This trip included business so we stayed here to make use if corporate discount. It was a great location on St Charles St. Walking distance from Bourbon St. If you feel like a stroll take a left out if hotel and walk straight fiwn St. Charles. You'll go past Lafayette Square and into the Museum District. We booked a King room with breakfast included. Next time we will drop the breakfast. For the money you can get a much better meal somewhere close. Staff was excellent. Vslet Parking was $26 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: DrTNG
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally located near the French Quarter and within walking distance of the shops and some of the main attractions such as the cathedral, museum, Bourbon St., and Harrah's casion. It was quiet at nights, clean, and comfortable. The view from the room was that of another building and since I like beautiful views, I was a little disappointed. With that said, we didn't spend much time in the room. New Orleans was quite an experience for me - my first visit, and I have mixed emotions about it. If you're a party person, you'd probably like it a lot. We had breakfast at the hotel which was included with our package, but we were limited in our choices. We also had free internet service, although one PC was not working for a long time and there were some problems with the internet. It was good to be able to use it for free though. We had no body lotion in the room but got some from the front desk. The doormen were pleasant and helpful. Although I expected a bit more, having stayed at other Courtyards before, overall, it's a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “first new orleans Visit”
Reviews.Author: William B
Reviews.Content: The perfect location for what we wanted to do. 4 blocks from Harrah's casino and one block from Bourbon Street. Staff was extremely friendly and courteous and helpful. We arrrived early and were allowed to check in upon arrival. My wife being a smoker asked if she had to go outside to smoke and the desk clerk said that would not be a problem and gave us a room with an outside balcony overlooking St. Charles Street.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Quiet, Not Scary!”
Reviews.Author: Babs0828
Reviews.Content: A block of rooms was booked at this hotel for wedding guests. We were going to make a reservation at another hotel because we were not familiar with this property, but decided to "go with the flow" and stay where the couple suggested. We are so very glad we did! The hotel was in the most perfect location. The Security Center (where the wedding was held) was a short walk away, perhaps a block. We felt safe walking around, even dressed up for a wedding. Canal Street was a block away. Bourbon Street was within walking distance. Cafe du Monde was within walking distance. The aquarium was within walking distance. Mother's Restaurant (divine) was within walking distance. In fact, we parked our car at the hotel on Friday and did not need it again until our departure on Monday morning. Although the hotel charges $26/day for parking, what we saved on gas and the stress of trying to park in a city more than made up for the fee. The humidity in this town was almost unbearable, so the convenience of a quick walk to Walgreen's and CVS on Canal Street for a hair de-frizzer remedied that issue! The hotel was extremely clean and quite. There were no obligatory hairs in the bathroom. Also, they provide Paul Mitchell shampoo and conditioner. I was really impressed by that! Our room had no view, but we didn't come to New Orleans to stare out the window of our hotel room. The air conditioning worked perfectly and was quiet, even though I kept it set at a steady 66 degrees. We were sad there was no room service, which we like for breakfast. Several restaurants deliver, though, and the front desk was more than helpful by offering menus to these restaurants. Only four stars were given because of a problem with billing on our last day. The final bill was under the door and was incorrect. I called the front desk at 4 a.m. and the man who answered (who claimed to be a manager) told me that I had made the reservation on December 13, 2011 and that was the rate I agreed to. I explained that I didn't even know there was going to be a wedding in December (we actually made our reservation in March 2012) and would have had no reason to call in December. He curtly told me that the computer showed that I had called and that is all there was to it. I asked him what I called about in December. He replied, "How should I know? You were the one that had the conversation!" I realized I was getting nowhere, so spoke with a different manager upon our 8:30 departure. Without batting an eye she adjusted the rate and apologized for the night manager's behavior. The valet parking staff were so friendly. They were quick to open the doors to the lobby with a smile and friendly greeting. We would definitely stay here again when we return to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Great Courtyard - Service - Location”
Reviews.Author: cathdav
Reviews.Content: We were at this hotel over the Memorial Day Weekend. It is an updated Courtyard and the service was very good. The doormen extraordinary and the location could not be beat. Between French Quarter and a walk to the museums. This was my first time in New Orleans and would go back in a heartbeat and to this Courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, friendly staff, clean...”
Reviews.Author: GL726
Reviews.Content: Updated Courtyard. Has the modern chic design which is good. Lobby lounge/sitting area is plentiful and nice touch with halogen lighting. Rooms are standard Courtyard rooms with one notable exception: the showers are MUCH better than any Courtyard I've been to. Serious $$ spent on the shower stall (pure tempered glass on sliding beam); hard to describe, but very nice feature/design. Staff was friendly and competent. Pretty much in the French Quarter (2 block walk) and even for access to Convention Center, it was only 10 min walk. Lots of good restaurants nearby and the New Orleans trolley line is 2 blocks away as well.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place but too expensive”
Reviews.Author: Doffa
Reviews.Content: For what you get for over 200 USD for a no window room this is too expensive for this place. The reception area is modern but not better than a any cheap hotel chain. Our room had no window (only a indoor window) which might be okay when you want no street noise at all. The breakfast is not included and must be paid seperately. Best of the hotel was the valet parking guy - superfriendly and active (his name is Tong). Other staff okay but not very outgoing. Location of the hotel is good (2 min walk to Bourbon street). Overall - we would not come to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Better than average Courtyard”
Reviews.Author: RM_BusinessTraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Courtyard for a convention, surprisingly the room rates and selection were quite good. I got an interior room, which means there are no exterior windows, just a window to the open atrium inside the building. Apprehensive at first, I came to enjoy the quiet and lack of morning sunlight. I think would be perfect if you were staying during Mardi Gras or a noisy convention. Overall ammenities are above average for the Courtyard brand. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: rdwhite
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel that has the usual amenities of a Courtyard. Room was clean and comfy. The hotel is across Canal from the French Quarter so not quite so noisy, but still an easy walk to the FQ. One negative aspect is the hotel has some interior rooms that face an indoor courtyard that gets no natural light. The room gave me a claustrophobic feeling. We asked to switch rooms and that was not problem eventhough they were sold out for the weekend. They changed our room to an exterior room with a balcony. It was much much better eventhough we got some of the noise from the outside the room was comfy and bright. If you want a quiet room ask for the interior room, but if you want some natural light ask for an exterior room. The staff was great. Check-in was quick and effecient and the folks at the front desk were always very friendly. They went out of their way to move us to the new room and to accomadate us, always with a smile and "no problem."

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: BobinBaltimore
Reviews.Content: Stayed on business. The hotel is right around the corner from the JW Marriott and just a couple of blocks from Bourbon Street. The lobby is very new and well-done. As with many recently rennovated Courtyards, they have definitely gone further upscale at this hotel. The little restaurant in the lobby is sizeable, has a good selection and is reasonably priced. A very nice improvement. They also have a little convenience store area for guests. The room on the 6th floor was nice, though not particularly large. The work area was ample and had two readily accessible outlets. Wifi was adequate in speed, though signal strength caused a few connection drops. Ethernet is available, too. The bathroom was clean and used natural stone on all surfaces. The shower was generously sized and had a very upscale rolling glass shower door. Nice touch. Towels were not very plush, but were clean. There are some obvious signs of the actual age of the hotel. The elevators are a bit raggged, some of the switches and outlets appear old, the themostat was old and yellowed (but functional), and the air handler was a bit noisey. None caused a problem. Bell staff was happy to provide restaurant recommendations and directions. All staff was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Choice For The Big Easy”
Reviews.Author: highdesertbadger
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent four nights here on a trip to NOLA. It's not the Ritz, but it's much cheaper and serves as a great location for a visit. The location makes it convenient to Bourbon Street and most other sights. It's right on the Street Car line and ticked the boxes for us for comfort and predictability. They serve Starbuck's in the very modest restaurant and provide internet access that worked well. Parking would be an expensive investment but we did not have a car. I'm sure that there are nicer hotels, but for the money I'd stay here again on a return to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, Close to French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: The_Chief4557
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to New Orleans and we only had a day and a half to take in some of the local sights so we decided to concentrate on the French Quarter area. We booked this hotel through the Marriott Web Site for what I thought was a reasonable rate that included a great breakfast every morning. After we arrived, we found out it was French Quarter Festival with lots of live music! From here, you are a two block walk to Bourbon Street or one block to the shopping district of Royal St. Every one on the staff we had contact with was very friendly and helpful. The newly renovate lobby looked fabulous. The room was clean and well appointed with a nice large glass enclosed shower in the washroom instead of the standard tub/shower combo. The only very minor irritant was the need to re-log on to the internet each day. A truly enjoyable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Mardi Gras!”
Reviews.Author: ravvlivius
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for Mardi Gras with friends. Hotel was conveniently located on french quarter of the city and been in the route for the parades. The crowds is just stroll away and bourbon street isn't far. It has nearby food stalls and convenient store to buy souvenirs. The room is standard but very clean, quiet, and nice. Bed and pillow is OK. Bath room is small but we have clean towels. Staff is hospitable and proactive to help us with Mardi Gras schedule and where to go on the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - beware credit card phishing scam”
Reviews.Author: Matt H
Reviews.Content: Liked the hotel. It's clean, which is not always the case in N.O. (W Hotels, this means you!) Friendly staff had rooms ready early and were able to accommodate a 1230 checkout. Unfortunately, criminals have hacked into the phone system. They called my room, impersonating the front desk and said they had a computer problem last night and lost all customer info. I played along until they asked for cc info. When I visited the front desk to complain, the woman behind the counter carelessly said, "That's a scam. You're the 2nd one to tell me about it." My advice to hotel management: warn your patrons when they check in and get your phone system fixed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: KIMMEBABY
Reviews.Content: My Family & I stayed here over the weekend, this is a wonderful hotel. The cleanliness, location, & the Staff where amazing. I really love how they upgraded the hotel itself & the rooms. The showers in the bathrooms are so gorgeous, the location is perfect your only a block from Canal St. I will most def be returning to lodge here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location!”
Reviews.Author: Basilio5
Reviews.Content: We stayed for couple nights on Mardi Gras and the location was perfect as it was right on main parade route, and only a couple of blocks from the French Quarter where all the fun chaos goes down. We had bigger rooms with 2 double beds and fridge, which we used as gathering place before hitting streets. Another couple with us got the smaller room with one king bed and no fridge, but the room was great for them two. Beds and pillows were comfortable, appearance was nice and contemporary.. can't really think of any negatives. I can't speak of room service since we were not there for that, but staff was very friendly and accommodating. We got lucky and got a great rare deal for the dates we stayed, but regular price is more than justified as this hotel feels more like 4 star rather than its 3 star rating. We would definitely recommend this hotel, especially for Mardi Gras!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our Mardi Gras visit!”
Reviews.Author: bocatherapist
Reviews.Content: Perfect for our Mardi Gras visit! Our room was clean and nicely decorated. In fact, the lobby area also seems to have had a nice face lift recently. Breakfast staff was friendly and patient. Our family (me and husband, 2 daughters) all stayed in one room but housekeeping kept leaving us 3 bath towels so each day we had to ask for more towels. They brought them to us very quickly though. Had trouble with room phone which they quickly replaced. Location is perfect for watching parades, shopping downtown, exploring French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Nice facility but staff needs training”
Reviews.Author: okcJohn
Reviews.Content: Stayed one Saturday night Jan 2012. We booked two rooms, one king for 2 and one double for 4 through marriott's website and rates were approx 220 and 260 per night including breakfast. Parking is valet and was approx 30 night. Check in was fairly painless but tried to give us two kings so had to remind them that needed a double. No mention that my package that was preshipped had arrived. The staff member was having several different conversations with several different people while trying to help me. Went to the rooms. The double was fine. The king was the smallest room I have ever stayed in (smaller than rooms in europe). I went down to inquire about my package and asked about the size of the room. The clerk responded that I must be in a room ending in 14 and that they were the smallest in the hotel as the are really just an adjoining bedroom to the corner suites. No offer to change room. (Not to be snobby but why would you put one of your elite members in the smallest rooms in your hotel? So much for inspiring brand loyalty) During this conversation, the clerk was having other conversations that she initiated with other staff members and other guests walking by. Late that evening, I decided to go for a walk and eralized that I left my jacket im my car in valet. I went downstairs and the lobby was empty except for 4-6 staff members in the lobby joking around. I had to ask who the valet was. After explaining what I needed, they went back to joking around. Finally, about 5 minutes later, another valet went and got my jacket. Rooms were nice and comfortable. There was toothpaste on the door jam in our room. It was a nice clear green color that was easily noticeable about 3 1/2 feet up from floor next to the sink. Did not hear any noise. The king room was in the backside of a little hallway which was block by maid cart. Although the maid saw us lifting or luggage up and carrying sideways to get through, she made no effort or offer to miove it. Breakfast was included in our rate so we went down for breakfast. The breakfast is in the lobby where you order at the counter. You basically get your choice from the menu which is somewhat limited. The food was decent. Service was horrible. we were not sure we were in the right place and waited at the counter to ask. The girl working the counter does not talk to you or recognize you until she is ready to. Not even a hello or be right with you. She looked like she needed more help behind the counter as she was preparing some of the breakfast items as well as drinks herseld while waiting on the counter. She only did one thing at a time and would not talk to youuntil wshe was finished with what she was doing. When she did help us, she was not friendly and left us to figure out how to get our drinks ...ie, take prepackage milk cartons from the cooler or would they bring out with the meal. At check out time, valet brought car around and disappeared. No offer to help with luggage or directions. I rated this hotel average because the facility is nice and as a general rule, service is poor in New Orleans. However, I expect more from marriott brands and they did not live up to that expectation. The Comfort Suites by Carlson located several blocks away is a far better value and service is much better. Location wise, it is very close to Bourbon.

Reviews.Title: “"Just right for our visit"”
Reviews.Author: vt90
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Courtyard for two nights the first week in January. The hotel has just completed a full renovation, so it feels brand new. Our room was standard, but very clean, updated and surprisingly quiet. The location was perfect and within walking distance to the French Quarter, Bourbon Street, and the Superdome.

Reviews.Title: “Renovation seems to be complete and we loved our stay”
Reviews.Author: GatsbyGal
Reviews.Content: The lobby and the restaurant are beautiful. It's updated and looks exactly like what a property in a major city should look like. We stayed over the Christmas holiday weekend and the hotel was pretty quiet overall. Speaking of quiet, the room we were in faced a side street and we didn't hear any street noise at all during our two-night stay. The staff was phenomenal. We were there Chistmas morning and the hotel had closed down the breakfast restuarant early because no one seemed to be eating there--well, until my husband and I showed up. Even though they were already closed, the Marriott employee who was just about ready to leave and go home to her family made sure we didn't go hungry and actually found breakfast sandwiches for us, heated them up, gave us fruit, yogurt and juices. Oh, and she didn't charge us for it.

Reviews.Title: “Speechless”
Reviews.Author: Tnfuturedr
Reviews.Content: My first time to New Orleans. My cousin bachelor party everybody stayed at the W hotel. I decided to stay at the courtyard since I get a discounted rate bad choice. The room was fairly clean until i noticed hair throughout the bathroom. Then there were blood stained sheets on my bed. Came back from Bourbon street tried getting in my room but the door wouldnt open. They said the door battery died and had me wait for the security guard who couldnt open the door either. I kept trying myself and it finally opened 45 mins later. The brightspot about this hotel is that its right across the street from Bourbon and Canal. The valets were nice and helpful. They watched my bags while I couldnt check in right away.

Reviews.Title: “Courtyard French Quarter Location”
Reviews.Author: Travel2much4work
Reviews.Content: This courtyard is conveniently located close to bourbon street and other Marriott hotels on Canal Street-which is how I ended up at this courtyard-as the Marriott on Canal was booked. The staff are super friendly (water and pretzels at check in). The lobby is new and the cafe is very nice with personal TVs in the booths with your own remote. The hotel rooms are terribly old and in great need of updates-including the bathroom, furniture, matress, and flooring. The hotel is under construction-noisy at night (checked in at 10pm-still working). Plastic is taped all over and workers are on site. It will be nice when they are finished. The gym is in an odd place-but small (2 cardio machines) with a hot tub next door that you can see from the gym. I had breakfast in the cafe-starbucks drinks made to order and brought to your table and low fat breakfast sandwiches. The cafe staff are short handed-but offer great customer service. Would stay again-once it is upgraded to match the lobby experience.

Reviews.Title: “Construction”
Reviews.Author: lstegall34
Reviews.Content: We were at this hotel for five nights and we were woken up at 7:30 am every morning including Saturday and Sunday. We were using points to obtain this stay and we were not able to move to another Mariott hotel . I did not want to pay for another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, large room, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Bellarina126
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend surprised me on a Friday morning with a trip to New Orleans for the weekend. He hadn't planned it, he just decided we wanted to go... and since there was a festival in town that weekend, I booked the first hotel I could and hoped for the best. The location of this hotel is FANTASTIC - it's far enough away to where the noise isn't an issue, but it's close enough to be able to walk everywhere and there is a stop for the St. Charles street car REALLY close. Our room was very large, especially by New Orleans standards and it had a balcony overlooking the street which was a nice perk. We had easy access to the galleries on Royal Street and could be in Jackson Square within 10 minutes on foot or by taking the street car that stops in front of Harrah's/Hilton. The staff was friendly and we were warned ahead of time to give valet plenty of time to pull our car around, as they were sharing a garage with another property a few blocks away. No problem - we didn't need/want our car until it was time to go anyway. I would stay here again, mostly because I don't like staying in the hub-bub of crowds while on vacation. I liked how convenient it was to the action, yet appreciated how removed it was whe n I was ready to go to sleep. Overall, for the price we paid at the last minute, the size of our room, and convenience, I think this hotel is a steal.

Reviews.Title: “Good times in the big easy!”
Reviews.Author: ktejera
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here while in NOLA for two nights. It was very convenient to everything that the city has to offer. The streetcar is right outside your door, there was a stop directly across the street. We rode one morning just to get a look of more of the city. St. Charles Street takes you out into the Art District, then you can also go over and catch the one that goes up Canal Street and at the end of the line there are two cemeteries there that you can check out. It was very cheap for an all day pass! The hotel was nice a clean, staff was very friendly! Answered any questions we had, and since we were rewards members we got a little gift bag at check in. We had booked our room and it included breakfast each morning for us, which was great! We didn't have to worry about going out of the hotel to find breakfast each morning! But, I wouldn't have ate there unless it had came with the cost of the room. We only paid $10 extra for our room with breakfast compared to without it. We got our money worth, because breakfast runs about $15 per person. We would stay here again, good price for the proximity to everything!

Reviews.Title: “An OK place in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: ualsdguy
Reviews.Content: First let me say the staff were very friendly and accomodating. The room we had was small and had a not so pleasent smell. The bed was an uncomfortable foam type thing. The hotel is in a convenient location just off Canal street, one block from Bourbon. The only reason we stayed here was because we had a free one night stay voucher and the hotel is in a good location. There are certainly better hotels in the area for comparable rates. There is a very small gym and an indoor whirlpool which was closed for some reason.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice lobby but old, room”
Reviews.Author: KJGator
Reviews.Content: The location is great with a St. Charles street car stop across street. The door man was always there to help by opening the door. The lobby was very modern and nice. With a nice set of computers to use in the back area of the lobby. The room was pretty drab. The furniture was old - dated. The bathroom had shampoo and conditioner but no body lotion. I never bring mine anymore due to the airport liquid requirements. The bathroom tile and tub were old - shower water pressure was weak. The bed was not that great - ok. If you aren't going to spend much time in the room, this might be the hotel for you. I have stayed in much nicer places in the same price range in New Orleans including the Hilton Riverside.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, just not great!”
Reviews.Author: PattyH999
Reviews.Content: We are Silver Elite Marriott and stay almost exclusively at this brand for business travel. Let me start by saying that the staff was friendly and quickly resolved problems. But, there were problems. Our first room was already occupied upon entering. We could have stolen the guy blind--billfold and computer in plain site. We were upgraded to a city view room for our inconvenience. The rooms are small and well worn. It's the French Quarter so I am sure they get alot of abuse during Mardi Gras. We had to call for a new iron and ironing board after almost ruining a shirt the next morning. One was promptly brought to us. The valet and doorman were friendly and helpful. The bartender in the Bistro--not so much. The front desk staff were helpful. We were allowed a late check-out on our last day due to a meeting delay. All in all, it was a good stay. The property could use some upgrades. Stained carpet in hallway and room. The lobby is the newer look for Courtyard, but rooms look tired and worn. Would stay here again for the location, but definately not our favorite Courtyard of record. The staff did resolve problems quickly and was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location,excellent valet service,friendly hotel staff.”
Reviews.Author: eneiford
Reviews.Content: My husband and I made a short trip to New Orleans for a business trip. We always stay at Marriott hotels when possible. The room booking was easy. The valet parking was efficient and the hotel staff were friendly and accommodating. Overall it was a great trip.

Reviews.Title: “If it's fun, tastes good, sounds right - then we're all for it! Welcome to The Big Easy!”
Reviews.Author: BlueMediterranean
Reviews.Content: Bonjou! Booked last minute via Marriott toll free number. Topped off slightly above 1 Benjamin. (100 dollars.) That was WITH a nice breakfast for two. The breakfast experience was different than the standard, but liked it. One receives two items from the hotel restaurant menu, french toast and joghurt avec fruit for example. One also is presented with a drink, say juice o-range. Coffee is located on a small side bar close to the lobby, free of charge. Then one can sit down in the restaurant seating, which is in a large room that is shared with the lobbby (some booths have tv screens where one can stay up to date with the news) and watch people, through large floor-to-ceiling windows, walking by the front of the hotel along St. Charles Avenue. Free newspaper also available. Parking however is extra, about 1 Jackson. (That's twenty dollars, right! You catchin' on child!) The rooms very clean. The beds quite com-fort-able. This particular Marriott is located on the edge of the Quartier Francaise, with close approximity to Bourbon Street and the mighty Mississippi. Adequate Cajun food can be found at Daisy Dukes restaurant, a couple of blocks away . Very good stay overall, in this solid hotel in the crazy, but bea-u-ti-ful city of N'awlins! Don't forget yer throws (beads), now! Ya hear!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, friendly and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: beartrippers
Reviews.Content: A quick one night stay in route from beach to home. The staff was friendly and the hotel lobby was modern and comfortable. Children loved own tv at one of the breakfast tables. Great A/C- it's really hot in NO in July. Rooms just like pictures, nothing out of ordinary. It was surprisingly quiet considering it's so close to French Quater and the street car went right under our window. I could barely hear it.

Reviews.Title: “French Quarter is Nearby”
Reviews.Author: Travelpair70
Reviews.Content: We selected this property because of its proximity to the French Quarter without paying the premium for staying in the Quarter. We were not disappointed. While the exterior is standard New Orleans , the interior is very modern with an atrium- type setting. Our room has normal size with new furnishings. Check-in was very prompt and the staff was cordial. We used their valet service for our auto and give them first class marks for promptness. Because of their location near the business district as well as the French Quarter, the clientele was a mix of the normal tourist and business people.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for the money, but would look elsewhere next time”
Reviews.Author: catherine_stl
Reviews.Content: When walking into the lobby of this hotel I was very impressed. The lobby area is very nice and modern. Staff was generally friendly and we had no problems with service. However, when we walked into our room, it was a stark difference from the lobby. The room was tiny with no window to the outside (the window was facing toward the center lobby courtyard area). The room was not in good condition as the tile floors in the bathroom were crumbling. Because of this, we asked to be moved to another room. They moved us to the top floor. This room seemed a little bigger. Higher ceilings maybe? But the room overall just felt very humid and still had no outside window. If I were a college student or visiting nola just for Bourbon Street this might have been an ok hotel, but I would not go back again until the rooms have been renovated.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff!”
Reviews.Author: PRRecBooks
Reviews.Content: Several people in my company stayed here this past weekend. I would have to say that the best thing about this hotel is the staff and the location - between the French quarter and the business district. All staff members went out of their way to be helpful, from the front door, to the check-in desk, to the maid staff. The lobby is new and modern, with great A/C! I had breakfast there twice and both times the food was solid, good for the price. The rooms themselves are in need of updating, as the carpets are a bit worn and the paint was peeling off the walls in the bathroom. My room was clean, but others in my group thought their rooms had an odd odor. I think once they are done renovating everything will be as nice as the lobby. Book a room with a balcony if you can, as that is a nice touch. Overall, pleased with the entire hotel except underwhelmed with the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and excellent staff.”
Reviews.Author: Bona0149
Reviews.Content: We had three rooms for three nights in this hotel. The desk staff was very helpful, the rooms were clean, the restaurant was great for breakfast. Location was within walking distance to Bourbon Street, shopping, French Quarter shopping, and the Mississippi.

Reviews.Title: “No parking, unhelpful staff”
Reviews.Author: BrianCons
Reviews.Content: There is very little parking in the area of this hotel and it is very unclear what one should do with their car, even while checking in. I circled this hotel for 20 minutes trying to figure out what to do, calling the hotel did no good; they do not answer the phone. After the parking debacle, waiting for 10 minutes at the front desk for someone to check me in, I finally loudly asked if anyone was around, a staff member finally came out to help. My needs are not great or complicated, I simply look for a clean hotel with minimal hassle checking in after a long flight late at night. This one did not provide that. I was booked for three weeks here, immediately after checking in I cancelled the final two weeks and booked myself elsewhere. I would suggest any business traveler looking for minimal levels of hassle do the same.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: PabloP
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect in every way. We had a terrible time getting to New Orleans and spent nights in Washington and Atlanta en route from Massachusetts (first flight canceled for mechanical reasons; second delayed overnight due to bad weather). So we arrived in NOLA two days late, frustrated and tired. The Courtyard staff members were SO nice. (Thanks, especially to Erika!) They didn't charge us for the reserved nights we missed. (I'd canceled the first night by the 6 pm deadline but hadn't been able to cancel the second because I didn't know we'd be stuck in Atlanta until it was too late.) The location was ideal ... a one-minute walk to the French Quarter but also well positioned for car or streetcar trips to the Garden District and Magazine St. (the latter was new to us and not to be missed. When I first heard "shopping street," I expected all the usual-suspect mall and outlet stores, but it was nothing like that and is well worth a visit for shoppers and non-shoppers alike.) Some other reviews of this hotel have mentioned street noise, but we didn't have any problem with that at all. Our rooms were quiet and clean and comfortable. Connecting to WiFi was simple and free (no annoying fees or passwords); the shower was super. The lobby breakfast bar isn't free (except for the coffee) but it was very convenient if you want to grab a light bite in the morning after a night of NOLA food overindulgence. Try the scones. (I liked them as much as the famous NOLA beignets!). Even though this is a chain hotel, I really felt that we were treated as if we were guests at a high-end boutique establishment. I will definitely stay here again the next time I'm in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Loud, old, and cramped. Would NEVER recommend to anyone.”
Reviews.Author: frequentflyer813
Reviews.Content: Honestly, there were only two nice things about this hotel: the location and the quality of the iron (but that's probably because it had never been used before). Other than that, I despised this hotel and would never, ever stay here again. First, although the lobby looks nice and has been recently renovated, the guest rooms are another story. As soon as you exit the elevator on your floor, you realize that the hotel is in desperate need of updating. The rooms are incredibly small and have entirely too much oversized furniture inside. Yes, many hotels could be subject to the same complaint, but if you ram you door into the dresser every single time you enter the room, that's a problem (in fact, it wasn't possible to open the door more than halfway when trying to get into the room, and that's not an exaggeration). But the worst part is that the hotel is the loudest I've ever stayed in at any point in my life, and I'm someone who has traveled a lot. The indoor atrium amplifies noise like crazy and the walls are paper thin, so plan on bringing earplugs. There is a restaurant on the first floor, but as far as I could tell, it was never open (I never saw anyone working there or eating there). Hotel reception was somewhat rude upon check-in, and whenever I tried to call the front desk, it would never get answered because the receptionist always seemed to be away from the desk.

Reviews.Title: “Really 3.5 Stars”
Reviews.Author: HonestReviewForU
Reviews.Content: A little better than average, this is a good choice for business travelers. Wired Internet only, but very fast at all times. (However, if you want to work on the couch bring your own cord because the hotel's is about a foot too short.) Had a nice, good size room overlooking St. Charles. Some street noise including the streetcar rattling by (hotel is just six stories tall, so no high floors here). But the A/C drowns it out. Unusual design has some rooms that only have windows looking inside the hotel, so if you want to see the street, tell them at check-in. No fridge in room, sorry to say. Also, as is Courtyard policy, no breakfast included, but free coffee in the lobby. Try the Harrah's buffet breakfast for $10. Good selection on TV. Plenty of hot water and good pressure in the shower. Bed wasn't the most comfortable (kind of saggy) and the pillows are mush. There's a self-serve washer/dryer on the 6th floor, $1 each and free box of Tide at the front desk. Three PCs w/printer in the lobby, plus two others w/printer that are only for boarding passes. Service was a bit uneven. Room wasn't made one day. Front desk folks are friendly enough, but only some are efficient. Short walk to French Quarter and Harrah's. At $143 (AAA) plus a load of taxes, not bad for where you are, and would be willing to return. I still prefer the Staybridge over on Poydras, but couldn't justify the $200 they were asking this time.

Reviews.Title: “The staff makes this hotel”
Reviews.Author: bsbar
Reviews.Content: You aren't in the JW Marriott or the Ritz, but the staff makes you feel like you are. The location is one block from Royal and Three blocks from Bourbon Street. The location is great for walking the French Quarter and not having the noise from Bourbon Street. It is quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Location is everything!”
Reviews.Author: westgordan
Reviews.Content: Exorbitant parking prices but nice stay. The Courtyard Marriott is a great hotel in a great location. Convenient to the French Quarter, Central Business District and Warehouse District, it is a short walk to anywhere. The staff was very friendly, knowledgeable and helpful. The hotel was extremely clean, comfortable, and accommodating. Didn't have a pool onsite, but was able to use neighboring hotel's pool (both owned by Marriott). The parking was extra at a rate of $ 30 per night. However, I parked on the streets for 2 nights and parked at a neighboring park lot for 2 nights at $15. The hotel has everything nearby within two blocks. Oh yeah, paid 36 dollars on a priceline bid.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TravelWell040
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location on the edge of the French Quarter and on the St. Charles trolley line. Good restaurants, tourist locations, and the Mississippi are within walking distance. The hotel staff is very friendly and efficient. We had a medical emergency requiring hospital treatment. The hotel staff quickly responsed with a 911 call and met the ambulance at the front door. The rooms are clean. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Under Construction!! Stay Away!!!”
Reviews.Author: Cameron06820
Reviews.Content: Great location. Nice rooms. But stay away until work is finished on the lobby and restaurant. The entire first floor is wrapped in plastic and filled with painters and carpenters. Check-in is in a large closet. No kldding. No vending machines on the floors, just a few snacks in the closet. There is no mention of this disaster area on the Marriott website. Why? Usually they warn you if you're walking into a mess, but this time nothing. Nice enough rooms. There are some on the 2nd floor with balconies. Otherwise they are hermetically sealed, ie no fresh air. During construction there's free "breakfast", though there was no coffee 2 of the 3 mornings I was there. Parking is $26 a day. I'm a Marriott Rewards "Gold" member and have reported this property. It's way out of compliance with the brand's otherwise strong track record.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, comfortable, clean and quiet”
Reviews.Author: Pauli_L
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in downtown New Orleans, you have restaurants and souvenir stores in the same block, tourist information and two restaurants across the street. The streetcar rides in the same street, although these old machines are noisy and my room was facing the street, I didn't heard any noise inside. Bourbon street is at walking distance from the hotel, and I think is safe walking there in the night. After the check out, I left my luggage until 5pm in the office of the reception without any problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Fabulous Service, Reasonable Price, & CLEAN!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kelly H
Reviews.Content: My husband & I chose to stay here for our first trip to NOLA due to the mixed reviews for hotels in the Quarter. We walked everywhere from Harrah's to St. Louis Cemetery #1 to Esplanade and back due to the superior location of this property. We booked early & made several requests, all of which were met. We even had a balcony!!! The valets were extremely helpful & courteous, as were the hotel staff. The best part was that breakfast was included!!! This is a place we'll seriously consider on our next trip to The Big Easy.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: ReineoftheRoad
Reviews.Content: My other half and I decided to pop to NOLA from KC on a whim. We called the hotel to check availability, and got a fantastic rate that included breakfast. We were two hours later than we thought we would be. The staff- valets, desk clerks, breakfast attendants, housekeepers- was excellent! Brandon the valet of all trades knew where everything was and how to get there. He parked our car, carried our bags, and was incredibly courteous on two different occasions. Our bed was comfy. The room- even behind the bathroom door (yes, I looked) was spotless, cool, comfortable, and quiet. Breakfast was more than adequate. My only complaint is that the hotel is not pet friendly. Normally, we travel with at least one very spoiled but well behaved dog, so we might not be able to stay here in future if our babies are travelling with us.

Reviews.Title: “Marriot doesn't care about security”
Reviews.Author: loyolagrad
Reviews.Content: While staying here in May 2010 our room was entered and approximately $1200 worth of personal belongings were stolen! Along with some moderately priced jewelry, an ipod, clothing, eyeglasses, keys, phone chargers, and medication were taken. The thief then used the bathroom (including our toothbrush!), leaving dirty towels behind. Marriot claims refuses to accept any accountability for this event. There are many fine hotels very close to this one. Stay somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Great Escape”
Reviews.Author: Royal414Pirate
Reviews.Content: I am entering a lifelong relationship with New Orleans - and I am pleased to say it is still in its infancy! Anyhow my torrid, passionate stolen weekends with my City soulmate are so driven by lusty energy and overexuberance that I need to over the course of the weekend hide away from it all - so I can heal... This hotel protects me when I need to come off the street at the end of the day. I can lie in bed comfortably recalling the days amazing foods and music..... or... maybe it is a great place to be if you have to throw up. the shower is awesome and here you can deal with some mean hangovers! God Bless New Orleans, LA!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Staff but Rooms Need Refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: 1NicePerson
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is the location. Less than one block from Canal Street, access to the French Quarter is convenient and safe. The welcome I received at reception was warm and sincere and it seems all the staff is courteous and friendly. The rooms, however, are sorely in need of refurbishment. Furniture is functional but shabby. My room was spacious but decor spartan and had the look of a 1980s Holiday Inn. Everything worked decently including wired and wireless internet (complimentary) but room just had a very dreary appearance and was well worn. If you get a good price here, you won't be disappointed. If the rates are high, recommend looking elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “location is best thing about this hotel”
Reviews.Author: LouisvilleKaren
Reviews.Content: we just got back from staying at the CY during Mardi Gras. This hotel is right on all the parade routes. If you love the parades, this is a great place to stay! However, there were downsides to this as well. It was incredibly hard to get back to the hotel from other parts of the city. And forget about any transportation. You had to walk. Cab driver dropped us 4 blocks away and we had to get our luggage there the best way we could. If you're staying at any other time, dont think you would encounter these problems. Not many restaurants right in the area. Subway, Quiznos and Serios Po boys. But the French Quarter is just right across Canal. Rooms are not very large and housekeeping was the biggest issue for us. She didnt leave any wash cloths, didnt change sheets when we requested, etc. Again, I guess this may have to do with Mardi Gras, but after all these years, would think this location had it down. Breakfast was ok and included with our room rate. I wouldnt have paid the $23.00 for 2 it was supposedly worth. It was eggs, sausage, grits, hard biscuits and runny gravy every day. No other food is served at this location but with the French Quarter so close, wasnt an issue for us. Ok place to stay. Best thing was location. We have stayed in better places in the quarter and would seek those out before staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean room”
Reviews.Author: KBear1118
Reviews.Content: We booked our room online and did a "prepay" for a small Queen room. Well, it should have said extra small. The was about 150 sq ft and that is being generous. Our room faced the courtyard which was not nice with people walking buy your window. Plus we did not have any outside windows. On the plus side, the breakfast bar was good. I suggest you get there early if you want biscuits and gravy because once they run out that it is for the day. They had a nice selection of pastries, bagels, make your own waffles and fruit and yogurt. The location as perfect and walking distance to everything from the Superdome (Geuax Saints), the French Quarter and French Market and the casino. The trolley stop was right out side the door. The staff was very pleasant and helpful during our stay. I would stay here again, but pay the extra for a regular room. The $20 a night was saved wasn't worth the smallness of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend at the Courtyard St. Charles”
Reviews.Author: megd80
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on the reviews of other Tripadvisor users and the price (127 per night with breakfast). While the bathrooms are a bit dated, the rooms are clean, and the beds are very comfortable. This hotel is two minutes from Bourbon right outside the French Quarter near Canal. The streetcar stops right outside and you can walk to all major downtown attractions. The breakfast was fantastic in the morning...a very good start to the day. I would highly reccomend staying in this location if you are on a budget during your New Orleans trip.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: hoops7k
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights. It is close to all the action but still quiet. If you stay in a room on St. Charles you will hear the street cars go by. Other then that a clean hotel with very helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: Gramercy97
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here four nights. I specifically chose this hotel because of its location after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor. The reasonable price was also another draw. We wanted something right outside of the French Quarter, but not too far away. This was perfect. The hotel is a few steps away from Canal, a block away from Royal, and only two blocks from Bourbon. An amazing location. The St. Charles streetcar stops outside of the hotel. Our room faced the front and there was absolutely no street noise. The blackout curtains helped too. We found the rooms to be clean, good sized, and the beds were very comfortable. There was no shortage of pillows either. There were enough outlets to charge our electronics given the three of us had cell phones and camera battery chargers. This was a huge plus. The rooms are equipped with free wifi, which I made great use of. The bathroom was on the small side, but okay. The shower pressure was amazing. Housekeeping were not stingy when giving us extra towels. The hotel also had a whirlpool hot tub that we used during our stay. Perfect for those long days of walking. The only drawback was that you have to make sure to put the Do Not Disturb sign outside or else housekeeping will try and enter your room in the early morning. We were surprised at this considering we got a knock on the door at about 8am. Also, the buffet breakfast was a bit expensive considering the area has plenty of places to eat for much cheaper - and better. We liked the free coffee and tea though. Overall, our experience was very positive. I would definitely stay here again and recommend it for others. The hotel was perfect in every way for what we needed. Again, if you want to be away from the French Quarter, but not too far, you cannot beat this location.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay... Perfect location...”
Reviews.Author: nyjets24
Reviews.Content: I couldn't have asked for a better place to stay in New Orleans. Very close to the French Quarter and you won't pay French Quarter prices... The St Charles Streetcar stops in front of the hotel. For a relaxing cheap ($1.25 / each way) trip through the scenic Garden Distric this is a must. Also, the hotel is about a mile from the Superdome and can be walked (and did for the Saints / Jets game). You don't need a car to see the city while staying here. We took the "Paddle and Wheel" Gray Line tour combo. (2 hrs on the Steamboat Natchez and a 2 hr bus tour which stops at a Cemetary.) Also recommended. At the hotel I booked the breakfast included rate, which was very reasonable, but also had a Marriott gift card to help with the overall costs. Even without the card I would have stayed here. The weather was in the 80's but overcast / scattered showers most of the 4 days we were there. This was a perfect time to go. Can't wait to go back...

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: hornet50
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night on 9-5-09. From the first the staff was great, check in was easy, and they remembered our names. When the bell man showed us to our room and it was obvious that someone had smoked in our non-smoking room, he called the desk and immediately got us a new room. He then took us directly to the new room, got housekeeping to get us in, and got us new keys. Room was adequate, with good beds and linen. Bathroom was good. Location was as close to the Quarter as I wanted to be. My only problem was that I could hear traffic noise clearly, including the St. Charles streetcar, which could be charming, but when you are trying to sleep, noise is noise. If you read the web site the extras are explained.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but I wouldn't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: RayRayUNC
Reviews.Content: I stopped here for one night after driving from Florida. The hotel itself is nice and the location is great. The price for the hotel was very reasonable($99.00) My complaint is with the "hidden" fees. The parking is $29.99 per night for valet or $29.99 for self parking! The morning we left we decided to go downstairs to get some breakfast. We decided on the buffet which was just OK, about 15 minutes into our meal the waiter came over and gave me a bill for $23.00. This is the only Courtyard I've ever stayed at that the breakfast wasn't complimentary. My $99 bill ended up being almost $170 after taxes.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: lkeh1
Reviews.Content: Rated very good and not great just b/c its not the Ritz. It was very clean, friendly and helpful staff-knowledgable about dinning and transportation. Location within a block of trolley stops. No pool but a hoy tub to soak tired walking feet in at the end of the day. We go a rate of $78 per night when we book early.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet oasis near the center of the action-Great location”
Reviews.Author: Williamfaith
Reviews.Content: We took our 6 year old son to New Orleans for our first visit since Katrina. In the past we have always stayed at a hotel in the French Quarter, which is convenient but ,sometimes noisy. After reading a few reviews, we booked a room here. Am I ever glad we did! Our room rate for one night here was about one-third what I paid in the French Quarter on our last trip. On arrival, the staff was pleasant and helpful. The room had two double beds and was adequate for the three of us. The room, the public areas, and the halls were clean and well maintained. The hotel is located on St. Charles Street, where it intersects Canal Street. When you walk across Canal Street, St. Charles changes to Royal Street . Bourbon Street is only one block away. There is a stop for the St. Charles Street car just outside the front door, which will take you to the Garden District or the Audobon Zoo. There are several tremendous restaurants within a couple of blocks. Some of them are even kid friendly. The hotel cafe is only open for breakfast (as in most Courtyards), and the food is just passable. You can pay a great deal more for a room that is not as clean, or as conveniently located, but why would you want to?

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!! Great value”
Reviews.Author: tripbear
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a short stay in New Orleans and I wanted to highlight how great this hotel was. The location is terrific relative to the price. Literally one half block from the French Quarter. Cross Canal Street and you are there. Friendly staff. Large new and very clean room. Flat panel TV and two comfortable large double beds took care of my family of 4. Free wireless internet and a computer and printer in the lobby which was also free (and helped me print boarding passes for the trip home).The price was $85 per night which made the whole experience outstanding. Only down side was the cost to park (about $30 per day after taxes). However I found a garage in the Quarter (Dickie Brennans'- on Iberville between Bourbon and Royal) which cost only $20 per day and was only 1 1/2 blocks from the hotel. which helped with that Having been to New Orleans at least half a dozen times, this was the best hotel stay I have had considering the cost, quality of rooms and location. HIGHLY recomended!!

Reviews.Title: “Great service / fairly good location”
Reviews.Author: sfuji1
Reviews.Content: Have never stayed at a Courtyard before and was not disappointed. Everything we asked for from late check out, baggage storage, to adjoining rooms was fulfilled. If you are picky about your beds as I am, the beds here were VERY comfortable. Room was large and clean. Only drawback is that if you have an inside room, the windows open up to the courtyard, meaning if you are getting dressed in the dark with the curtains open, folks get a free peep show. It was very quiet, so not sure if the same can be said for the rooms with an outside view. Located a little outside the French Quarter, Starbucks is around the corner. No need to rent a car. Parking is expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jbird1277
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel at the last minute using Marriott rewards points. The only room available online using points was a room with 2 double beds. I called the 800 number and asked them to make a note for an upgrade to a king room with balcony if available. Upon check-in, I was given the king room. Check-in was smooth and friendly. The room was smaller than most Courtyard rooms, but this is to be expected in the city. The room was clean and confortable. There was also a small refrigerator in the room. Internet is free, but it is not wireless. The bathroom was quite small and somewhat worn, but was adequate for a short stay. Breakfast was ok, with cooked to order eggs and a bar with hot and cold items. It was included with my room rate. I would not have paid the inflated price for it, as there are many good places to eat nearby. The best feature of this hotel is it's location! Just a short block from the French Quarter. I easily walked the entire French Quarter from the hotel. It is also on the St. Charles Streetcar line. It is in a safe area. I traveled alone and did not feel unconfortable walking back to the hotel alone at night. I would definately stay here again when in New Orleans!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: valor155
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel with my friends on a visit to Nawlins and the French Quarter. Perfect location. Easy walk to the French Quarter and the goodness that is Bourbon Street. All my buddies were telling me how "sweet" the location is, and for the price, this was great. We all had a blast in Nawlins, and a big part of that was the location of this hotel. Also, friendly check in folks, and folks at the bar too. Easy to connect to internet. Easy to access business center. I guess the only complaint I can register is that it would have been nice if they put our rooms closer to each other. The rooms were all on the same reservation, but were scattered throughout the hotel. Minor complaint, in the end. Highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Nawlins who want to be close to the action.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: bonafide_usa
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I stayed at this hotel during the Essence Festival during the July 4th holiday. The hotel is in a great location, clean and the staff is very courteous! I will definitely stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: HulaGirlNashville_Tn
Reviews.Content: Great location! Only a block from the Quarter! We were fortunate to book one of the balcony rooms overlooking St. Charles. It was a standard Courtyard room, slightly small, but we were only there to sleep so it was perfect. Be sure to hop on the streetcar and cruise through the Garden District. An excellent tour for under $2.00. Hop off at the end of the line if you would like to enjoy a coffee, pastry, or a casual breakfast or lunch at La Madeline.

Reviews.Title: “Niiiiiiiicccceeeee!!!!”
Reviews.Author: LangStonR
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for about a week on business in May. I have to say that it was much nicer than I expected. The staff was especially helpful. If you ever need anything, ask for "Bull". He was the concierge that does everything and anything for hotel guests. Including, coming in on his days off. The rooms were quite comfortable, but a little on the small side. Anyone who has ever stayed in NYC know what I'm talking about. There is a small fitness that has a whirlpool in the adjacent room. I looked in there and both seemed on the older side. However its better than nothing. There's no pool, but who goes to New Orleans to swim. The hotel is located right off Canal Street which is the major thoroughfare in Downtown New Orleans. It's not even a block from the French Quarter which is where I was every night. The hotel lobby is rather small also, but right off the lobby is a bar. Right next to the bar is a small CPU that has internet in case you need it. Overall I rather enjoyed the hotel. Everything was clean and not too noisy. What more could you ask from a hotel. Even better than that, you can't beat the location. Like I said before, you're minutes from the French Quarter and Riverwalk. There's a McDonalds and a Popeye about 1000 ft away for all those that don't want to pay $15 a meal in the French Quarter. Every Wednesday in Lafayette park there's a huge music festival that you don't want to miss if you get the chance. It's only about a 4 block walk from the hotel. And if you're drinking down on Bourbon Street, you gotta try the "Hand Grenades".

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly fine for the Money”
Reviews.Author: 4ddawgs
Reviews.Content: This Courtyard is fine for the money. I agree with others the rooms are small and need the Marriott update burt it was clean and the staff was very accomodating. The breakfast was typical Courtyard. The Breakfast attendant was super nice and very eager to please. You are less than a block from Royal Street and are on the St Charles Street Car line. All in all for the price I say thumbs up

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for the Price”
Reviews.Author: tleray
Reviews.Content: My husband surprised me for an overnight trip to New Orleans. We live a little over 2 hrs away, so I have been to NO several times and stayed at some of the best hotels (Royal Sonesta, Chateau Sonesta, etc). For the price you can not beat the location. You are 1 block over from what is considered the french quarter. You cross canal and you are on Royal, which the quarter is known for the Bourbon and Royal streets. The hotel is ok, I wouldn't give it negative reviews, for an economical traveler looking for a decent room and location without paying $300 a night this is your place. Just some things to note: Hotel bar isn't open on weekends only Mon - Thurs (which I thought was odd). They do have a market pantry where you can purchase beer, cokes, chips, medicine, etc. Would not recommend a 1st floor room facing street, we did and got very little sleep. Also they do have a computer you can use with internet in the lobby/bar area. One last thing, beds are super hard so if your used to a soft bed, you might wake up with a back ache. Again as mentioned this hotel is not a luxury hotel by any means, just a good price and location for an inexpensive getaway!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but needs updating”
Reviews.Author: tempejim
Reviews.Content: The Courtyard New Orleans St. Charles has a couple things going for it. First is its location, splitting the distance between the business district and bourbon street. It is right next to the J.W. Marriott and on the St Charles Streetcar line. The hotel is clean and quiet. My room faced an interior courtyard so I didn't hear any street noise. The room was dated though seeming to come right out of 1995. There was no wireless internet access and the TV was small (probably a 19"). The bathroom was dark and the shower had some bizarre controls. The decor was corporate Marriott and didn't have much to tell me I was in New Orleans. That said it was a clean room, the staff was very helpful. At checkin they called me by my name and the bell man was always quick to get a taxi. The morning buffet was $12.95 and was very good. The hotel was very close to bourbon street and the French quarter so the nights were never boring. I will probably stay there again if just for the location and the staff, but Marriott (or whoever owns the hotel) needs to update the interior to match 2008 New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cato16
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a good location for the French Quarter, RiverWalk and French Market. The rooms are not huge. There was a daily breakfast buffet for $9.95. I didn't eat it, but it seemed pretty cheap. There is a hotel bar, but it rarely had anyone in it. Overall, I was happy with the stay for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel- clean - no frillies”
Reviews.Author: Meredith A
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful no frillies hotel room. We were lucky enough to get the best room in the house with a awesome balcony. It is just the right distance from the action.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: planningzone
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location. It is one block from Canal and Bourbon St. the rooms are a little small and they are a little loud because they all face inward (with a window facing the inside of the hotel) to a 6 or 7 story atrium. Two of the three nights I woke up to loud talking or yelling???? from the atrium. I still rate the hotel above average because it is very clean and it has a great location. The staff was also very nice...... laid-back, casual..... but nice. I am not a very demanding traveler. I just want a clean room in a safe convenient location, and this fit the bill. If you are downtown for a conference, YOU MUST GO OUT AND SEE THE 9TH WARD!!!!!!!! Downtown is totally put back together, but you are not getting remotely the whole story of the city till you see outside the downtown area!!!!!! I was at a conference but took a break to tour the 9th ward and it was one of the best things I did on the trip. I was much more patient with the hotel staff knowing what many of them are going through!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Mardi Gras Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: cewayfarer
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 7 nights for Mardi Gras 2007 and couldn't have been happier! The location absolutely can't be beat for watching the parades! We'd head out, set up out chairs, come back in and have a cocktail at the bar and when the parade began to start, we'd head back out. In addition, the hotel always had coffee and tea available to guests, which came in really handy on those icy cold February nights! They also have a little 'store' which came in handy for those late nights when you just HAVE to have a Snickers bar! The staff were all very friendly. I think housekeeping was a little overwhelmed by the large numbers of guests, but they were always polite and did a good job. The front desk staff were also very helpful and friendly. We never made it down in time for breakfast, but heard other guests speak highly of it. My husband was especially pleased with their gym. They have all new equipment; treadmills, elipticals, etc. He is usually disappointed in hotel gyms, but said this one was the best he'd ever used! We'll never stay anywhere else for Mardi Gras again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, only a block from Bourbon Street”
Reviews.Author: orbops
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel one block from Bourbon Street. The rooms itself are a little small, and the only windows face inside the hotel, but the location is perfect! Since the area itself near the hotel is very constricted, valet parking at $22.00 per night is your only option. The breakfast buffet is reasonably priced with all the basic foods you'd expect to find in a small breakfast buffet. The rooms were quiet and clean, and the air conditioning was a forced air wall unit, so it was also very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “1 block away from Bourbon St.”
Reviews.Author: 1EZrider
Reviews.Content: After 4 nights at the Hyatt attending a conference, we moved to the Courtyard. The Hyatt was too far from the French Quarter. The Courtyard was only 1 block from the beginning of Bourbon St., and within walking distance of most of the Quarter. Each morning we by-passed the Breakfast at the Courtyard and caught the Street Car right outside the doors. We rode to the Garden District each Morning and found several great places for Breakfast. The room at the Courtyard was clean, comfortable and a bit plain. The bed and pillows were very good; the mattress soft and the pillows large. Since we didn't spend much time in the room, it worked very well for us.

Reviews.Title: “About what you'd expect for the price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for three nights during this year's Jazzfest. We were very happy with the location, just a couple of blocks from the French Quarter. The staff was mostly pleasant and accomodating, however, the room was not that great. The room (single, queen) was very small and not as clean as I would've liked it. The carpeting was very worn and not that pleasant to look at. Fortunately, we didn't spend much time in the room and had a great stay overall. The breakfast buffet was ok for the money, but a little confusing as far as service goes. One person working all the tables, taking orders, filling coffee, setting utensils, and collecting payment. I probably wouldn't stay here again, but rather pay a little more for a nicer place. My Marriott rewards played a large part in deciding to pick the Courtyard in the first place.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mich Traveler 2
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in many New Orleans hotels, but the Courtyard on St. Charles was by far the best. In a city where small rooms are the norm, the Courtyard has surprizingly large rooms. Ours was very clean, very quiet (even though the street car passed just below us). The staff here is extremely professional and friendly. The breakfast is superb ($9.95 for a better than average hotel buffet). The proximity to the French Quarter, Harrah's, Aquarium and the River Walk shops is excellent. The use of the internet in the hotel lobby is a great feature! The next time I'm in N.O. I will definitely try to stay at the Courtyard on St. Charles.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Comfortable Room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, within walking distance to all the sites from Bourbon ST to the Riverwalk. The staff was very friendly and happy to assist. The first room I checked into had a very strong odor, and the staff was very accomodating in switching my room. Some of the rooms have balconies, which are very fun to sit on. I would stay here again, especially since the price is ususally right.

HotelInfo.Name: Courtyard New Orleans Downtown Near the French Quarter
HotelInfo.Address: 124 St. Charles Avenue, New Orleans, LA 70130
